resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Edinburgh Castle Medieval castle overlooking the city of Edinburgh from Castle Rock. The site includes the 12th century St Margaret's Chapel, and has been a royal residence through the centuries, having been besieged more than any other castle in Europe. Visitor information for Edinburgh Castle A landscape painting by Patrick Nasmyth, depicting Edinburgh Castle in the background, from the University of Edinburgh's collections
resource.chars:
Edinburgh Castle

Medieval castle overlooking the city of Edinburgh from Castle Rock. The site includes the 12th century St Margaret's Chapel, and has been a royal residence through the centuries, having been besieged more than any other castle in Europe.

Visitor information for Edinburgh Castle

A landscape painting by Patrick Nasmyth, depicting Edinburgh Castle in the background, from the University of Edinburgh's collections

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Arthur's Seat View of a snowy Arthur's Seat in January 2010, from the University of Edinburgh Library's collections An ancient volcano, now a popular tourist spot within the grounds of Holyrood Park with commanding views of Edinburgh and its surroundings. Not long before this lithograph was created, a group of boys discovered a small cave here where they found 17 miniature coffins, now on display at the National Museum of Scotland. You can read more about the mystery on the Museum's website.
resource.chars:
Arthur's Seat

View of a snowy Arthur's Seat in January 2010, from the University of Edinburgh Library's collections

An ancient volcano, now a popular tourist spot within the grounds of Holyrood Park with commanding views of Edinburgh and its surroundings. Not long before this lithograph was created, a group of boys discovered a small cave here where they found 17 miniature coffins, now on display at the National Museum of Scotland. You can read more about the mystery on the Museum's website.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Salisbury Crags A series of cliffs, part of nearby Arthur's Seat, within the grounds of Holyrood Park.  Engraving of Salisbury Crags from 1826 by J. Fife after W. Westall, from the University of Edinburgh's collections
resource.chars:
Salisbury Crags

A series of cliffs, part of nearby Arthur's Seat, within the grounds of Holyrood Park. 

Engraving of Salisbury Crags from 1826 by J. Fife after W. Westall, from the University of Edinburgh's collections

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text:
Craigmillar Castle
Built in the late 14th century with links to Mary, Queen of Scots. Read more about its history and plan your visit on <a href="https://www.historicenvironment.scot/visit-a-place/places/craigmillar-castle/history/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Historic Environment Scotland's website.
resource.chars:
Craigmillar Castle

Built in the late 14th century with links to Mary, Queen of Scots. Read more about its history and plan your visit on Historic Environment Scotland's website.
